description: After the deployment of specific security patches related to CVE-2024-38246, users may observe elevated privileges unexpectedly granted to standard users on Windows systems. This symptom presents a risk of unauthorized access where an attacker could gain system privileges. End users may notice unusual access to sensitive settings or files, which normally would not be accessible to them. The components affected include multiple Windows 10 and 11 builds, specifically versions 21H2 through 24H2. The relevant KB Articles are KB5043080, KB5043076, KB5043067, and KB5043064, highlighting the importance of implementing these patches promptly to mitigate the risk of such privilege elevation incidents.
